doc.previous: where the coefficients A B C etc may depend upon x and y If over a region of the xy plane the PDE is second order in that region This form is analogous to the equation for a conic section
doc.after: More precisely replacing x by X and likewise for other variables formally this is done by a Fourier transform converts a constant coefficient PDE into a polynomial of the same degree with the top degree a homogeneous polynomial here a quadratic form being most significant for the classification
